result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M. Buehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon M. Buehler in court, in custody with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Atty Tlusty.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists. Court finds plea given, freely, voluntarily and intelligently; accepts plea; finds DE guilty.  Atty Siehr makes statement.  Court imposed a withheld sentence and places DE on probation for 3 years with conditions of: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 3 months in the County Jail concurrent to any current sentence; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Court dismissed and read in Ct. 2. ba

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Initial Appearance on December 15, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $500.00 cash bond with conditions of: booking; not to possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription; not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for December 15, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. -ba
